intro: Descurainia menziesii, commonly known as yellow rocket, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is native to North America and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can be found in prairies, woodlands, and along roadsides. It has alternate, pinnately compound leaves and produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds. Yellow rocket is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to thrive in various soil conditions.
